00009 ORDataProcManager::ORDataProcManager(ORVReader* reader, ORRunDataProcessor* runDataProc)
00010 { 
00011   // the optional runDataProc argument allows the user to pass in an
00012   // overloaded ORRunDataProcessor
00013   if (runDataProc != NULL) {
00014     fRunDataProcessor = runDataProc;
00015     fIOwnRunDataProcessor = false;
00016   }
00017   else {
00018     fRunDataProcessor = new ORRunDataProcessor;
00019     fIOwnRunDataProcessor = true;
00020   }
00021 
00022   SetReader(reader);
00023   SetRunContext(new ORRunContext);
00024   /* Sets fRunContext.  This class owns this object. */
00025 
00026   if (dynamic_cast<ORSocketReader*>(fReader) != NULL) {
00027     fRunDataProcessor->IncreaseHeartbeatVerbosity();
00028   }
00029   fRunAsDaemon = false;
00030 }
00031 
00032 ORDataProcManager::~ORDataProcManager()
00033 {
00034   if(fIOwnRunDataProcessor) delete fRunDataProcessor;
00035   /* This class owns fRunContext. */
00036   delete fRunContext;
00037 }
00038 
00039 ORDataProcManager::EReturnCode ORDataProcManager::ProcessDataStream()
00040 {
00041   if (fReader == NULL) {
00042     ORLog(kError) << "ProcessDataStream(): fReader == NULL: "
00043                   << "you must set a ORVReader before attempting to process data"
00044                   << std::endl;
00045     return kAlarm;
00046   }
00047 
00048   EReturnCode retCode = StartProcessing();
00049   if (retCode >= kFailure) return kAlarm;
00050   
00051   while (1) {
00052     retCode = ProcessRun();
00053     if (retCode >= kAlarm) return kAlarm;
00054     if (retCode >= kBreak) break;
00055   }
00056 
00057   return EndProcessing();
00058 }
00059 
00060 ORDataProcManager::EReturnCode ORDataProcManager::ProcessRun()
00061 {
00062   // always allow all processors to try to process a run
00063   SetDoProcessRun();
00064 
00065 
00066   ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): calling fReader->Open()..." << std::endl;
00067   if(!fReader->Open()) return kBreak;
00068 
00069   EReturnCode retCode;
00070   size_t nLongsMax = 1024;
00071   UInt_t* buffer = new UInt_t[nLongsMax];
00072 
00073   bool continueProcessing = true;
00074   ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): reading header..." << std::endl;
00075   continueProcessing = fReader->ReadRecord(buffer, nLongsMax);
00076   if(continueProcessing) {
00077     if(fHeaderProcessor.ProcessDataRecord(buffer) != kSuccess) {
00078       ORLog(kWarning) << "ProcessRun(): First record was not a header! Can't continue reading run." << std::endl;
00079       continueProcessing = false;
00080     }
00081     fRunContext->SetMustSwap(fReader->MustSwap());
00082 
00083     /* Also check to see if we can write to the reader. */
00084     if (ORVWriter* theMonitor = dynamic_cast<ORVWriter*>(fReader)) {
00085       fRunContext->SetWritableSocket(theMonitor);
00086     } else {
00087       fRunContext->SetWritableSocket(NULL);
00088     }
00089   }
00090   
00091   if(continueProcessing) {
00092     ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): loading dictionary..." << std::endl;
00093     if (!fRunContext->LoadHeader(fHeaderProcessor.GetHeader(), fRunAsDaemon)) {
00094       /* We have encountered a problem loading the header file. */
00095       /* Kill Run, try going to the next run. */
00096       ORLog(kError) << "ProcessRun(): Error loading header file.  Stopping run." << std::endl;
00097     } else {
00098       ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): setting dataIDs..." << std::endl;
00099       SetDataId();
00100       SetDecoderDictionary();
00101       
00102       ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): start reading records..." << std::endl;
00103       while (fReader->ReadRecord(buffer, nLongsMax) && fDoProcess) {
00104         fRunContext->ResetRecordFlags();
00105         if (!fRunAsDaemon) {
00106           fRunDataProcessor->ProcessDataRecord(buffer);
00107         }
00108       
00109         if (fRunContext->GetState() <= ORRunContext::kStarting) {
00110           retCode = StartRun();
00111           if (retCode >= kFailure) KillRun(); // but keep processing: skips to next run
00112           if (retCode >= kAlarm) return kAlarm;
00113           if (!fRunAsDaemon) {
00114             fRunDataProcessor->OnStartRunComplete(); 
00115           }
00116         }
00117       
00118         // let all processors process the data record
00119         if (fDoProcessRun) {
00120           if (ProcessDataRecord(buffer) >= kAlarm) return kAlarm;
00121         }
00122       
00123         if (fRunContext->GetState() == ORRunContext::kStopping) {
00124           break;
00125         }
00126       
00127         /*
00128         if (ORProcessStopper::StopNow()) {
00129           ORLog(kTrace) << "ORProcessStopper stopped data processing..." << std::endl;
00130           break;
00131         }*/
00132 
00133         if (TestCancel()) break;
00134       }
00135       ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): finished reading records..." << std::endl;
00136       
00137       retCode = EndRun();
00138       if (retCode >= kAlarm) return kAlarm;
00139       if (!fRunAsDaemon) {
00140         fRunDataProcessor->OnEndRunComplete();
00141       }
00142     }
00143   }
00144 
00145   ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): calling fReader->Close()..." << std::endl;
00146   fReader->Close();
00147 
00148   delete [] buffer;
00149   /*
00150   if(ORProcessStopper::Stop()) {
00151     ORLog(kDebug) << "ProcessRun(): ORProcessStopper is stopping the run processing..." << std::endl;
00152     return kBreak;
00153   }
00154   else*/ 
00155   if (TestCancel()) return kBreak;
00156   return kSuccess;
00157 }
00158 
00159 /*
00160 void ORDataProcManager::Handle(int)
00161 {
00162   ORLog(kWarning) << "Caught ctrl-c, trying to exit nicely" << std::endl;
00163   EndRun();
00164   fRunDataProcessor->OnEndRunComplete();
00165   EndProcessing();
00166 }*/
00167 
00168 void ORDataProcManager::SetRunContext(ORRunContext* aContext)
00169 {
00170   fRunDataProcessor->SetRunContext(aContext);
00171   ORCompoundDataProcessor::SetRunContext(aContext); 
00172 }
00173 
00174 void ORDataProcManager::SetDataId()
00175 {
00176   // Not necessary to SetDataId of fHeaderProcessor -- it is always 0x0!
00177   if (!fRunAsDaemon) {
00178     fRunDataProcessor->SetDataId();
00179   }
00180   ORCompoundDataProcessor::SetDataId();
00181 }
